citation.article-title: Phyllobacterium catacumbae sp. nov., a member of the order 'Rhizobiales' isolated from Roman catacombs.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Phyllobacterium (ex Knösel 1962) Knösel 1984
The description is as given by Knösel (1984a) with the following modifications.
Acid production from adonitol, dulcitol and glycerol is variable.
Members of the genus Phyllobacterium are not restricted to tropical leaf nodules but can also be present in hypogean environments.
The DNA G+C content ranges from 53·8 to 61·3 mol%.
The type species is Phyllobacterium myrsinacearum.
The genus includes two species, P. myrsinacearum (heterotypic synonym P. rubiacearum) and P. catacumbae.
